thread.title: Martha Stewart on Preserve: ‘Sometimes shuttering is good’
thread.title_full: Martha Stewart on Preserve: ‘Sometimes shuttering is good’ - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Martha Stewart on Preserve: ‘Sometimes shuttering is good’
text:
Kevin Mazur/WireImage Martha Stewart and Blake Lively attend the TIME 100 Gala in 2011. Doyenne of domesticity Martha Stewart has spoken out about Blake Lively’s decision to shut down her Stewart-esque lifestyle site, Preserve.
“I'm totally supportive,” Stewart told Us Weekly on Monday about the demise of the busy actress and mom’s lifestyle website after one year.
“But you know what? Maybe you can't do everything at the same time."
Lively has long considered Stewart her "idol," and was hoping to emulate her success with a company that specialized in showcasing handcrafted items from notable artisans.
The two also became friends in recent years, with the lifestyle guru helping the 28-year-old plan her 2012 nuptials to Ryan Reynolds and serving as a "kind of mentor" in the early stages of Preserve's launch.
Even so, Stewart suggested that Lively should focus on acting over entrepreneurial pursuits.
"Listen, she's a movie actress. Why bother with commerce right now? She's at the top of her career," she noted.
Gilbert Carrasquillo/FilmMagic Blake Lively shut down her lifestyle website Preserve one year after its launch. “Sometimes shuttering is good.”
The “Age of Adaline” star seemed to agree with the 74-year-old mogul about taking on too many duties, based on a recent Instagram photo poking fun at Preserve's untimely end .
“One day I’ll stop wearing so many hats," she captioned a photo of herself wearing several hats.
Lively first announced last month that she was shuttering the site , telling Vogue she pulled the plug because “it’s not making a difference in people’s lives, whether superficially or in a meaningful way.”
The mother of one also revealed that she is planning a relaunch with the aim of reaching “millennials through storytelling and ... creat(ing) a shoppable lifestyle.”
Preserve officially closed down Monday with an Instagram post thanking fans for “sharing your stories and Preserving with us.”
Related Stories Blake Lively pokes fun of Preserve shutdown Blake Lively to shut down troubled website Preserve Martha Stewart to Blake Lively: ‘Why would you want to be me?’ Tags: blake lively , martha stewart
